text: The 1997-98 Austrian Cup was Austria's nationwide football cup competition. It was the 64th season of the competition. SK Sturm Graz were the defending champions.Austriasoccer.at ==First round== *First round with teams from the second league ==Second round== == Round of 32== == Round of 16 == == Quarter- finals == ==Semi-finals == == Final == *SV Ried: Ronald Unger, Faruk Hujdurović (61. Oliver Glasner), Alexander Jank, Günther Steininger, Goran Stanisavljević, Manfred Rothbauer (90. Oliver Graf), Markus Scharrer, Michael Angerschmid, Herwig Drechsel (90. Stefan Hartl), Helmut Zeller, Gerald Strafner coach: Klaus Roitinger * SK Sturm Graz : Kazimierz Sidorczuk, Franco Foda, Darko Milanic (30. Mario Posch), Günther Neukirchner (70. Joseph Spiteri), Wolfgang Hopfer, Hannes Reinmayr, Markus Schupp, Roman Mählich, Gilbert Prilasnig (25. Tomislav Kocijan), Ivica Vastić, Mario Haas coach: Ivica Osim ==Top goalscorers== Rank Player Club Goals 1 Maciej Sliwowski Vfb Admira Wacker Mödling 5 2 Bruno Friesenbichler Schwarz-Weiß Bregenz 4 2 Hannes Reinmayr SK Sturm Graz 4 2 Arnold Freissegger SV Spital an der Drau 4 (German) == References == Category:Austrian Cup Category:1998 in association football Category:1990s in Austria
title: 1997–98 Austrian Cup
